src package¶

Submodules¶

src.config module¶

src.main module¶

src.main.main()[source]¶

Main function to run the scraper on a list of movies and save the results to CSV.

Reads the input CSV with IMDb URLs, scrapes data for each film, and saves the results to a CSV file. It also merges the scraped data with the original ratings data and saves the extended dataset.

src.utils module¶

src.utils.append_or_create_csv(scraped_data, file_path)[source]¶

Appends new scraped data to an existing CSV file, or creates the file if it doesn’t exist.

Parameters:

  • scraped_data (list or DataFrame) – The new data to be appended or saved.

  • file_path (str) – The path to the CSV file where the data should be saved or appended.

Returns:

The DataFrame after appending new data or creating a new file.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

src.utils.get_existing_rows(file_path)[source]¶

Reads the CSV file at the given path and returns the data in the specified columns. If the file doesn’t exist or is empty, returns an empty DataFrame with columns [“Const”, “Title”, “URL”].

Parameters:

file_path (str) – The path to the CSV file.

Returns:

The DataFrame with columns [“Const”, “Title”, “URL”], or an empty DataFrame if file is empty or doesn’t exist.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

src.utils.merge_and_save(merged_df, input_path, output_path)[source]¶

Merges the scraped data with the input ratings file and saves the result.

Parameters:

  • merged_df (pd.DataFrame) – The DataFrame to be merged with the ratings.

  • input_path (str) – Path to the input ratings CSV.

  • output_path (str) – Path to save the merged DataFrame.

src.utils.request_and_parse(url, suffix='')[source]¶

Fetches and parses the HTML from the given URL + suffix.

Parameters:

  • url (str) – The base URL of the IMDb page.

  • suffix (str) – The suffix to append to the base URL (e.g., “fullcredits”, “keywords”).

Returns:

The parsed HTML content of the page.

Return type:

BeautifulSoup

src.utils.scrape_credits(page_html, role)[source]¶

Scrapes credits for specific roles (e.g., writers, producers, composers) from the page HTML.

Parameters:

  • page_html (BeautifulSoup) – The parsed HTML content of the full credits page.

  • role (str) – The role to scrape (e.g., ‘writer’, ‘producer’).

Returns:

A list of names for the given role, or pd.NA if not found.

Return type:

list

src.utils.scrape_details(page_html, detail_class)[source]¶

Scrapes specific details like country, language, and company from the page HTML.

Parameters:

  • page_html (BeautifulSoup) – The parsed HTML content of the main page.

  • detail_class (str) – The CSS class to search for (e.g., ‘title-details-origin’ for countries).

Returns:

A list of details (e.g., countries or languages), or pd.NA if not found.

Return type:

list

src.utils.scrape_film_data(film_row)[source]¶

Scrapes all the film-related data from a given IMDb URL.

Parameters:

film_row (str) – The IMDb page URL of the film.

Returns:

A dictionary containing all scraped data for the film.

Return type:

dict

src.utils.scrape_keywords(page_html)[source]¶

Scrapes keywords from the page HTML.

Parameters:

page_html (BeautifulSoup) – The parsed HTML content of the keywords page.

Returns:

A list of keywords, or pd.NA if not found.

Return type:

list

src.utils.scrape_metacritic_score(page_html)[source]¶

Scrapes the Metacritic score from the page HTML.

Parameters:

page_html (BeautifulSoup) – The parsed HTML content of the main page.

Returns:

The Metacritic score, or pd.NA if not found.

src.utils.scrape_mpaa_rating(page_html)[source]¶

Scrapes the MPAA rating from the parental guide.

Parameters:

page_html (BeautifulSoup) – The parsed HTML content of the parental guide page.

Returns:

The MPAA rating, or pd.NA if not found.

Return type:

str

src.utils.scrape_profits(page_html, profit_class)[source]¶

Scrapes profit-related information (like budget, gross values) from the page HTML.

Parameters:

  • page_html (BeautifulSoup) – The parsed HTML content of the main page.

  • profit_class (str) – The CSS class related to profit data (e.g., ‘title-boxoffice-budget’).

Returns:

A list of profit data (budget, gross), or pd.NA if not found.

Return type:

list

src.utils.scrape_technical_details(page_html, spec_id, html_tag)[source]¶

Scrapes technical details like color, aspect ratio, and sound mix from the page HTML.

Parameters:

  • page_html (BeautifulSoup) – The parsed HTML content of the technical page.

  • spec_id (str) – The specification ID to search for (e.g., ‘colorations’, ‘aspectratio’).

  • html_tag (str) – The HTML tag to search for (e.g., ‘a’, ‘span’).

Returns:

A list of technical details (e.g., colors, aspect ratios), or pd.NA if not found.

Return type:

list

src.utils.scrape_top_cast(page_html)[source]¶

Scrapes the top cast members from the page HTML.

Parameters:

page_html (BeautifulSoup) – The parsed HTML content of the main page.

Returns:

A list of top cast members, or pd.NA if not found.

Return type:

list
